column1: Kincheloe was born in Detroit, Michigan but grew up in Cassopolis, Michigan.
He was interested in aircraft from a very young age.
He attended Purdue University, where he majored in aeronautical engineering, joined the ROTC and was a member of Sigma Phi Epsilon-Indiana Alpha fraternity.
In the summer of 1948, the ROTC cadet was able to meet Chuck Yeager and sit in the cockpit of the Bell X-1.
After graduating in 1949, Kincheloe received his commission in the U.S. Air Force.
At this time, he had reached the rank of captain.
For this he was nicknamed "America's No. 1 Spaceman".
He was killed in the crash of an F-104A at Edwards AFB, and was buried with full military honors at Arlington National Cemetery.
